Such activities include but are not limited to activities related to: (1) the design, development, production, or use of nuclear materials, nuclear facilities, or nuclear weapons; (2) the design, development, production, or use of missiles or support of missile projects; and (3) the design, development, production, or use of chemical or biological weapons. The Principal represents and warrants that it is a U.S. Government Authorized Party and not a Restricted Party, and neither party shall participate in any economic boycott not sanctioned by the United States Government or provide information that could be construed to support such unsanctioned boycott. These assurances shall survive and remain in effect even after termination of this Agreement.

(g) Non-Boycott Commitment. The Agent acknowledges and agrees that it will not engage in any economic boycott not sanctioned by the United States Government, or provide information that could be construed to support such unsanctioned boycott, during the term of this Agreement or thereafter.    (i) clearly specify the alleged Material Breach, Material Fraud, or Material Willful Misconduct;

   (iii) request that the Responding Party likewise have the option to appoint an arbitrator within a reasonable timeframe.

The allocation of Scotts' expenses will be determined by a mutually agreed-upon percentage, considering the headcount associated with each functional area supporting the L&G Roundup brand within the relevant business unit. This includes human resource functions, site/administrative services, legal services, and corporate services that are not assigned to other areas.

The expenses for human resources will encompass salaries, incentives, fringes, travel & entertainment, computers, communications, and space & supplies dedicated to the L&G Roundup brand. Furthermore, these costs will incorporate external fees and consulting expenses related to human resource matters not assigned to other functions.

For legal services, the expenses will consist primarily of salaries, incentives, fringes, travel & entertainment, computers, communications, space & supplies, and any other costs associated with maintaining in-house counsel or engaging outside attorneys for work on the L&G Roundup brand. Specific external legal fees and services will be billed directly to the relevant business unit.

Corporate services used by the L&G Roundup brand that are not assigned to a functional area will also be included, with either party having the right to bill for these services if agreed upon in advance by business unit management. The allocation of such corporate services to the L&G Roundup business will be based on an agreed-upon percentage of the actual costs billed to the relevant business unit.

The method for determining/allocating revenue/expense categories outlined in this Schedule 3.3(c) will be reviewed and approved during the Annual Business Plan process. The definition and allocation methods for each category, as well as anticipated sources of revenue or expenses, are subject to this review.

modified:
SCHEDULE 4.2(a) ADVISORY COMMITTEE In Favor of the Principal:

The Principal shall have the discretionary right to appoint members, and may choose not to convene or participate in any meeting, while still being entitled to receive all communications and updates related to the Committee's activities. The Agent shall provide reasonable assistance in facilitating the Committee's meetings at the Principal's request, but shall not be responsible for making decisions on behalf of the Committee or for implementing its recommendations without further instruction from the Principal.
